utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did you see our bank statement? Could this be right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know...God. I haven't seen my savings take a hit like this since I was a kid and they came up with double-stuffed Oreos. What happened to all our money?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm not sure what they did...but I'm inclined to blame .

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I guess with you doing the internship, we're spending more than we're bringing in.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Maybe I should quit and get a job that pays.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh...But you're finally doing something that you love! I can't ask you to give that up. Though it'd be nice if the thing that you love was...y'know...finding gold.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know what? You know what? I think we're making too big a deal out of this. ok? So we pay our bills a little late this month. And maybe next month we cut back on a few things. And maybe we start eating out of Joey's refridgerator for a change. You're a chef...what can you make out of baking soda and beer?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok worse case scenario is...we borrow some money from my parents.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! We're not borrowing money.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because we don't do that. We are Bings! And if there's one thing my father taught me was...well to always knock before going into the poolhouse...But the other thing was...never borrow money.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! I had no idea you had this much pride.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's right! I do! And I'm your man. And i'm going to get us through this situation even if it means you working twice as hard.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I'm gonna go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I haven't been home in a couple of days and I need to get somemore clothes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh...you don't have to go...I have something that will fit you.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I put that tube top on as a joke.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I want you to stay.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I want to stay too but I've got about as much out of these boxers as I can.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why don't you turn them inside out?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Done it. I'll be back in a couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'll miss you.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You know what? I just realized something. I don't wanna go home.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great! Ok...I'll go get the tube top.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: No, no! What I mean is...I hate going back to my apartment now...And partly because I live above a known crack den but...mostly because when I'm there...It's just...i really miss you. So...Do you want to move in together?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow...Mike Hannigan...You sure know how to make a girl say "Hell yeah!".

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: So we're doing it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Let's do it! Let's live together!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh god...We're really going to move in together!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I've always wanted to live with a guy..."Pick up your socks!" "Put down the toilet seat!" "No! We're not having sex anymore!" It's gonna be fun!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen...I need to know that what I'm about to ask you will never get back to Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'd be lying if I said I haven't thought about it myself...Chandler is my best friend...It would be wrong. Good. ...But wrong.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: : Ok first of all...It would be great. But that's not what I'm here to talk to you about. I need to borrow some money.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Awww...I don't know Monica...You know...erm...lending friends money is always a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But Chandler lent you money!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And I think he would tell you it was a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on...I just need it for some rent and...and some other bills.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh...how much?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Two thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Two thousand dollars!? What do you think I am? I soap opera star!?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's right I am!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi you guys!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oo...what's in the bag?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh er...well you know Emma started crawling? I realized that this place, is very unsafe for a baby. So I went to the store and got some stuff to baby-proof the apartment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh...baby-proofing...Why is this such a big deal now? Y'know...when I was a kid it was like... "Whoops! Joey fell down the stairs!" or er... "Whoops! Joey electrocuted himself again!" Huh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Anyway erm...Are you going to get a handyman to install this stuff?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. I was just going to do this myself.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You're gonna do it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah...Why? You don't think a woman can do this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh...Women can. You...can't.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica...would you please tell Joey that he is a pig?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You're a pig. And you can't do this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wha!? What!? Come on! I found the hardware store all by myself!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The hardware store is right down the street.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There is a hardware store right down the street?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey you guys! Ok...we've got great news.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Phoebe and I are moving in together.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know it's so exciting! You know I've never lived with a guy before.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well you know it's just like living with a girl. Only they don't steal your makeup. Unless they're playing "This is what my sister would look like".

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah...she's not so cute.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: OK...Well you put down the toilet seat.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yes dear.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is that a bit you guys do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh huh...we're playing you two.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We don't do that! Tell her we don't do that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes dear.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can't believe you guys are moving in together. That's...that's great! I mean...I'm happy for you guys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I hear wedding bells.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Monica slow down! Ok? I'm just excited to be living with him. You know I mean...I don't know...Can I see someday being married to Mike? Sure! Yeah...You know...I can picture myself walking down the aisle in a wedding dress that highlights my breasts in an obvious yet classy way. But do I want that house in Connecticut...you know...near the good schools where Mike and I can send Sophie and Mike Junior... Oh my god I do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe...I had no idea you were so conventional.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know! I guess I am! Oh my god! Load up the Volvo I want to be a soccer mom!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! You bet roomy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don't you mean...groomy?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh please...these guys...we haven't even moved in yet and they have us picking out china patterns.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: China patterns!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is easy...Can't do this!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Wow! Seriously I can't do this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Joe!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Listen er...I need to ask you a favor but you can't tell Monica anything about it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I thought you didn't have secrets from Monica.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And that would have made the official party line. Monica and I are having a little financial trouble.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah...I know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? What do you mean you know?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ER...I just figured it out! You know...I mean you're not working and the economy is bad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh! Right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Anyway, er... I need to borrow some money.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Sure! How much? Two thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! Two thousand dollars exactly! How do you know that!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Er...Well I...Know how much you used to make...And I know how much your rent is.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh ok.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Er...Kind of.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can't believe her! Did she tell you we were having money problems?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no no no no no...It wasn't...It wasn't because of your money problems...It was for something...for her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Something personal.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What would she get for herself for two thousand dollars that she wouldn't tell me about?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Boob job.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't want her to get a boob job! That's crazy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well it's...It's not THAT crazy. ok? Making them smaller, that would be crazy.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Well hey...I wanna ask you about Monica's little "groomy" joke.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Alright. Well I think the reason people laugh is becuase it's a play on the word roomie.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I get the joke. Sophisticated as it was. Now the thing I wanna say is...Maybe we should have talked about this before. Us living together. You're not expecting a proposal...right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! No no! Not at all. We're just moving in right now. See where it goes.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah well...that's the thing. For me it's...as far as it can ever go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Look. Phoebe...I...I love you. Very much. But I never want to get married again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Wow.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: It's just my first marriage was...you know... such a disaster. I kind of lost faith in the whole idea.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Was it really that bad?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: At one point near the end she deliberately defecated.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok...well that's bad...But don't you think it might be different with someone else? Perhaps a blonde who always uses a toilet. Except for once in the ocean.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Look it's not about who I would marry. And I was certain the first time I got married it would last forever. And I was totally wrong!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But it's just.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Look Phoebe...It's not about you. I just never wanna get married again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Are you ok with that? Cause if not...maybe us moving in together isn't the best idea.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! I definitely don't wanna get married. No I just wanted to make sure you didn't want to too. Whew! Coz you know when we move in...and you start changing your mind...there's gonna be hell to pay mister!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Trust me...I will never.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I get that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So you gave in and decided to call someone?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah...I don't know who I was kidding. I can barely use chopsticks.

utterance.speaker: Handyman
utterance.content: You're all set.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh thank you so much. Oh oh wait! You forgot your erm...Your game.

utterance.speaker: Handyman
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Rach! There she is...My perfectly proportioned wife.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don't look at me I never get his jokes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no...don't thank me. Thank you. You know there's not one thing I would change about you? Not one single thing! And definitely not...TWO...single things.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok...you're being weird. Do you want sex or did you do something bad?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No no! I just love the way you look... I am warm...for your form.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok...You know the old classics, you know, "You look nice"? They're still ok.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well yes yes...You look nice can mean that your face looks nice. I want to compliment your BODY. I mean...I wouldn't change it...At all. And more specifically, I wouldn't want anything to get any bigger.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I mean...You wouldn't want any part of me to get any bigger would you? Don't answer that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just when you thought that dude couldn't get any weirder.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, why do you think he was so worried about me getting bigger?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't know! I mean...what brought that on?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god. We're trying to get pregnant so he's probably starting to freak out about the fact that my body is going to change.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No...you really think that's what it is?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You heard him! "No bigger!" "You're perfect!" "Just don't get any bigger!" Oh my god he sounded just like my high school wrestling coach. You know what? I'm going to have to talk to Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! If you don't I will! Of course your body's gonna change. Your breasts are gonna get bigger...Your ass is gonna get bigger...You're gonna lose bladder control. God! It's just such a magical time!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Listen, I wanted to ask you something about marriage.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh great now you're seeking me out to make jokes? I mean I can see for all hanging out but to come to my home!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No...i really wanted to know how you feel about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mike doesn't ever wanna get married.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Never?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Never.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: wow...are you still going to move in with him?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I want to...but I just want you to tell me that marriage isn't really that big a deal. You know...that I won't, I won't be missing out on anything. That marriage stinks!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah...marriage...stinks! I mean if you wanna see a man gain weight and a woman stop shaving? Get them married.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That's not how you really feel is it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I'm sorry. LOok I don't think that's what you wanna hear right now but I can't help it. I love marriage.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Seriously? You divorce-o?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: If you have to call me name, I prefer Ross the Divorcer. It's just cooler. Look...I know my marriages haven't exactly worked out. But I love to be that committed to another person. And Caroline and I had some good times before she became a lesbian! And once afterward. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's ok that's how you feel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But come on! I mean living together will be great! I mean you guys have so much fun...and you love Mike.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I do love Mike.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah see? And you are so excited about moving in together before... and you know what? You should be. It's a big deal!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I guess you're right. Yeah thanks. This helped. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The Divorcer, to the rescue!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's not cooler.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah I just heard it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rachel!?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: SO I CAN'T DO ANYTHING I LIKE!?!?!?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Rach! Ah...Perfection. Wouldn't change a thing. Not a thing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: About that? Erm...I'm going to change.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But honey you don't have to.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm going to get bigger!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey I...I love your breasts the way they are!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Argh. ***.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, my breasts are going to get bigger weather you like it or not! And you know what? It's not just my breasts. My ass is going to get bigger too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: YOUR ASS?!?!?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Man, don't be surprised if her hands and her feet get bigger too!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They...DO that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's kind of a package deal!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: God why why would you want to do that to yourself!?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I thought I was something that we both wanted!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright look...if it means that much to you, I may be able to get on more with the big boobs. But the giant ass and the big clown feet?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god Chandler! If you can't handle this, what are you going to be like in the hospital? With the blood and the screaming and the little present that's shooting out of her!?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey! Why did you tell Chandler that Monica was getting a boob job?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because she is!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, Chandler knows I borrowed the money.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Mmmm hmm! For your boob job!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: OK so I'm out four thousand dollars and nobody's boobs are getting any bigger?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! What do you guys think about this. Ross. The Divorce-Force.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Better.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Very cool.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Phoebs...You know I'm I'm really glad you came to talk to me the other day and I hope I was a little helpful.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah you were helpful! Yeah...No, thanks you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good, good. Yeah coz the more I thought about it, the more I realized I don't think marriage is necessarily the right path for you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I know the other day in the coffeehouse you were caught up in the whole soccer mom thing? but...is that really you? I mean can you honestly picture yourself in a Volvo?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: They are awfully boxy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know...you'd be so bored with marriage. I mean it's so...normal.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey hey, can I help?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well! We er...climbed up four flights of stairs, maneuvered a narrow hallway, dodged a rabid pitbull...but these last three feet are where it gets REALLY tricky.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know, sometimes your words, they hurt.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey eh...where do you guys want this?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah...seriously coz this is really heavy. I mean not for me because I'm only pretending to hold this, but for these guys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Just one last time erm...the marriage thing...there's no wiggle room? None at all?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: No but... You don't want to get married either right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Right. Except that I do want to get married.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You...wanna get married?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Someday.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Aaaaand...hernia.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I haven't exactly had a normal life and I never really felt I was missing out on anything but it just feels that now it's my turn some of the regular stuff.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: But if you wanna get married why didn't you say something before?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because I just didn't know how much I wanted it. And I love you, and I wanted to live with you.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I want to live with you too! Let's do that!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But I don't think I can! it was ok to move in when I didn't know what was gonna happen, but I can't move in knowing that nothing is ever gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Can we at least try living together? I mean you might change your mind about marriage.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you gonna change yours?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Me neither. I think I need to be with someone who wants what I want.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: But I don't want this to end.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don't want it to end either.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I can't believe this is gonna end. I guess I'll have my stuff packed up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Ok...so. Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: Bye bye Mike! See ya Mike.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm so sorry Phoebs.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We're all sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah...look on the bright side...I mean you won't have to live with this ugly chair! That was here already huh? I love you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: AH HAH! I DID IT! HA HA! Alright. Better take all I can carry...Who knows when I'll be able to get in here again!
